title: V-Rooms Launches DocuSign Integration
text: Reprint DALLAS , July 14, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- V-Rooms Â®, a leader in the online distribution and storage of sensitive documents to address cybersecurity concerns, is pleased to announce the full integration of DocuSign, the leading online e-signature solution, into our cloud-based virtual data room solution - V-Rooms Pro+. Logo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150713/236033LOGO "This valuable electronic signature service via integration with DocuSign will be a tremendous value to V-Rooms' clients in helping them complete business transactions more efficiently," said V-Rooms President, Karen Perkins . "Our clients' administrators will be able to keep transactions digital and manage e-signatures seamlessly from within our platform. Administrators will be able to easily send documents needing an electronic signature directly from their virtual data room on any browser or mobile device and receive the signed documents back into their data room."V-Rooms is excited to formally launch this integration with DocuSign and already has several clients going live on this combined solution which provides several client benefits including: Easily send any document for e-signature to one or multiple signers Signers are not required to be V-Rooms users Documents are e-signed online through an intuitive user interface Administrators monitor status after a document is sent for signature Immediate email notification when documents are e-signed A final PDF version of the signed document(s) stored in V-Rooms DocuSign's e-signature services, along with V-Rooms platform, are both designed to save client's time and money by eliminating the need for paper copies and related time consuming tasks (i.e. printing, faxing, etc.) making this a perfect integration. With DocuSign integration, V-Rooms continues to set itself apart from the competition by providing best-in-class service through API integration partnerships which also include Wufoo, a SurveyMonkey company offering web forms integration, and plans to integrate this year with other 3rd party applications like Salesforce and Dropbox. 1 of 2
